definitions.definition: To fill or load (related to cargo or a shipment).
To weigh down , oppress , or burden .
To use a ladle or dipper to remove something (generally water).
examples: to lade water out of a tub, or into a cistern

definitions.definition: To transfer (molten glass) from the pot to the forming table, in making plate glass .

main_definition: To fill or load (related to cargo or a shipment).
secondary_definitions: To weigh down , oppress , or burden .
To use a ladle or dipper to remove something (generally water).
To transfer (molten glass) from the pot to the forming table, in making plate glass .
( nautical ) To admit water by leakage.
